page.title: 18TERROR RAID AT PUBLIC HOUSE
page.content: At 2am on Monday 2nd July 1985,two raiders armed with a gun and jemmy broke into the (Three Legged Cross) in Warfield. The raiders wearing red stocking masks, entered the premises through an upstairs toilet window. The landlord Mr Turton, was kept in bed while his wife was forced at gunpoint to go downstairs to hand over Â£1000 from the weekend takings. Before the raiders left they tied the couple together. We went to Bracknell Police Station to interview Sgt. Ginty about the crime. Police officers were on the scene within minutes and an area search using sniffer dogs was made. Vital clues were found. A description of the raiders was broadcast and road blocks were set up. Apparently this is not a common crime here; there is every chance the culprits will be caught.
